Course_title: IT Acceptable Use Policy Training Course
quiz_titles: ['It policy usecase','Use th Password for protection','Who are User for it']
q_evaluationSummary: Quiz generation is highly grounded in source content, factually accurate, and demonstrates strong relevance to all policy sections with appropriate question distribution across all five lessons.
justification: "The course content is exceptionally well-grounded in the source IT Acceptable Use Policy document, with all key concepts, requirements, and prohibitions accurately represented and expanded into learner-friendly educational content. Completeness is high, with comprehensive coverage of policy purpose, scope, prohibited activities, personal device restrictions, access management, password security, and incident response procedures. Each lesson contains multiple sections with detailed explanations, practical examples, learning tips, and assessment questions. Response length balance is strong, with each section providing sufficient detail without being overly verbose, maintaining engagement while ensuring thorough understanding. Context token overlap is excellent, as the course extensively incorporates and explains core concepts from the source document including ownership rights, monitoring practices, prohibited activities, role-based access, password confidentiality, and compromise response protocols. The content successfully transforms policy language into instructional material while preserving all critical information and requirements. Minor deductions reflect opportunities for even more varied examples across different user scenarios, though the current content is comprehensive and highly effective for training purposes."

justification: The course content is thoroughly grounded in the source IT Acceptable Use Policy document, with all lessons directly derived from the five policy sections. Completeness is excellent with comprehensive coverage of all policy areas including purpose, scope, related policies, prohibited activities, system ownership, monitoring rights, personal device restrictions, access management, password security, and incident response. Each lesson contains multiple sections with detailed explanations, practical examples, learning tips, and reflection questions with answers. Response length is well-balanced with substantive content that is neither too brief nor excessively verbose—each section provides sufficient detail for learner understanding while maintaining engagement. Context token overlap is very high as the content extensively incorporates key concepts, terminology, and requirements directly from the source policy document including specific prohibited activities, password requirements, monitoring rights, access principles, and security procedures. The structure follows the exact lesson titles provided and includes properly formatted quiz widgets at the end of each lesson with sequential quiz IDs starting from 5. All widgets are placed in individual rows and columns for proper rendering, and the JSON structure is valid and complete.

justification: The course content demonstrates exceptional grounding in the source policy document, with all lessons directly derived from the five main sections of the IT Acceptable Use Policy. Completeness is excellent—each of the five lessons contains multiple comprehensive sections with detailed explanations, practical examples, learning tips, and reflection questions with answers. Response length balance is well-maintained, with each section providing sufficient detail (30-50 words for descriptions, 60-100 words for content widgets) without becoming overly verbose. Context token overlap is very high, as the course consistently uses key terminology and concepts from the source document (e.g., 'staff,' 'IET systems,' 'login credentials,' 'IT Service Centre,' 'Password Guidance,' 'UK GDPR,' 'Computer Misuse Act') while transforming policy language into learner-friendly instructional content. The structure follows the exact lesson titles provided, includes quiz widgets at the end of each lesson with correct quiz_id numbering starting from 6, and maintains proper JSON hierarchy with each widget in its own row/column structure. All prohibited activities, password requirements, and access management procedures from the source document are accurately represented and explained with practical context for learners.

justification: The course content is exceptionally well-grounded in the source IT Acceptable Use Policy document, with direct alignment to all five policy sections. Completeness is excellent with all 5 lessons fully developed, each containing 2-4 sections with comprehensive explanations, practical examples, learning tips, and assessment questions. Response length is well-balanced—content is detailed enough to be instructional without being verbose, with each section containing 20-30+ word descriptions as required. Context token overlap is very high, as the course extensively reuses and integrates core concepts from the policy (system ownership, monitoring rights, prohibited activities, password security, access management, accountability) while transforming policy language into learner-friendly instructional content. Each lesson includes exactly one quiz widget placed correctly at the end using the specified quiz_id sequence (11-15). The structure strictly follows the JSON schema with proper hierarchy (lessons→sections→rows→columns→widgets), and all widgets are placed in individual rows/columns for predictable rendering. The course successfully avoids document-reference language and uses clear, student-focused instructional tone throughout.
